                      seccommerce.secsigner.applet.SecSignerApplet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
Direct Known Subclasses:
SecSignerAppletCertCheck
public class SecSignerApplet
extends javax.swing.JApplet
implements java.lang.Runnable

SecSignerApplet HTML-interface for signing.
This applet constitutes SecSigner's HTML-interface for signing documents/data and posting results to a given URL. 

 Applet params:
 Init                             'on': Do not sign a document, but post user's certificates only.
 Modal                            'on': Call SecSigner applet 'modal'.
 DocumentURL                      URL of the document to be signed (exclusive use with Document and DocumentBase64)
                                         Use "fileopen:*.pdf" to show a file open dialog. The file name filter is optional.
 Document                         document to be signed            (exclusive use with DocumentURL and DocumentBase64)
 DocumentBase64                   document to be signed            (exclusive use with DocumentURL and Document)
 DocumentStreamURL                URL of the document stream to be signed (exclusive use with DocumentURL/Document/DocumentBase64)
 FileSubject                      Name of file open dialog to be displayed for document loading (exclusive use with Document, DocumentURL and DocumentBase64)
 OldSignatureURL                  URL of the optional previously created signature object, to which the new signature shall be appended (exclusive use with OldSignature)
 Base64OldSignature               optional previously created signature object, to which the new signature shall be appended (exclusive use with OldSignatureURL)
 DocumentURL.n                    URL of the document [n] to be signed (exclusive use with Document and DocumentBase64)
 Document.n                       document [n] to be signed            (exclusive use with DocumentURL and DocumentBase64)
 DocumentBase64.n                 document [n] to be signed            (exclusive use with DocumentURL and Document)
 DocumentStreamURL.n              URL of document stream [n] to be signed (exclusive use with DocumentURL/Document/DocumentBase64)
 OldSignatureURL.n                URL of the optional previously created signature object [n], to which the new signature shall be appended (exclusive use with OldSignature)
 Base64OldSignature.n             optional previously created signature object [n], to which the new signature shall be appended (exclusive use with OldSignatureURL)
 DocumentType                     ID for document format (text=0, HTML=1, binary=2, image=3, PDF=4, XML=12, RTF=13, ZIP=14, ZKS=15)) (exclusive use with Mime-type)
 CipherCertURL                    URL of a certificate the signed pkcs7 object is ciphered with
 CipherCertURL.0                  URL of a certificate the signed pkcs7 object is ciphered with
 CipherCertURL.1                  URL of a certificate the signed pkcs7 object is ciphered with
                                         The list can be continued, but there must be no gaps and no duplicates in the numbers.
 CipherCertBase64                 URL-encoded, Base64-encoded certificate the signed pkcs7 object is ciphered with
 CipherCertBase64.0               URL-encoded, Base64-encoded certificate the signed pkcs7 object is ciphered with
 CipherCertBase64.1               URL-encoded, Base64-encoded certificate the signed pkcs7 object is ciphered with
                                         The list can be continued, but there must be no gaps and no duplicates in the numbers.
 EncryptDataOnly                  "on" or "off" to encrypt data without or with signing
 PostURL                          URL to post the signature and additional data specified with PostParams
 PostParams                       comma separated param list of additional params to post
 PostSignedData                   "on" or "off" to include signed data in http-post
 PostCertificates                 "on" or "off" to include signer's certificates in http-post
 PostFileName                     "on" or "off" to include document file in http-post
 SignatureFormatType              ID of the desired signature format: 0 = PKCS#7, 3 = PDF, 4 = XML-DSIG, 5 = PKCS#7 embedded
 FinishURL                        URL called after processing the PostURL
 FinishURLTarget                  Target for URL called after processing the PostURL
 CancelURL                        URL called on user cancellation
 CancelURLTarget                  Target for URL called on user cancellation
 ErrorURL                         URL called on internal technical problems
 ErrorURLTarget                   Target for URL called on internal technical problems

                                         Parameters for XML DSig signature for a single document:
 XmlDSigSignatureId               XMLDSig signature ID: This ID is inserted as id value in signature element node
 XmlDSigNodePath                  node path to be signed
 XmlDSigNodePathBase64            base64 encoded node path to be signed (exclusive use with XmlDSigNodePath)
 XmlDSigTransformMethod           Optional XPathTransformFilter: transform method, can take values 0 (intersect), 1 (subtract), or 2 (union)
 XmlDSigXPathExpression           Optional XPathTransformFilter: XPath expression
 XmlDSigXPathExpressionBase64     Optional XPathTransformFilter: Base 64 encoded XPath expression (Note: ALL expressions must be either base 64 encoded or not)
 XmlDSigNameSpace.Key.0           Optional XPathTransformFilter: namespace HashMap key
 XmlDSigNameSpace.Value.0         Optional XPathTransformFilter: corresponding namespace HashMap value
 XmlDSigNameSpace.Key.1           Optional XPathTransformFilter: namespace HashMap key
 XmlDSigNameSpace.Value.1         Optional XPathTransformFilter: corresponding namespace HashMap value
                                         The list can be continued, but there must be no gaps and no duplicates in the numbers.
 XmlDSigTransformMethod.0         Optional XPathTransformFilter: transform method, can take values 0 (intersect), 1 (subtract), or 2 (union)
 XmlDSigXPathExpression.0         Optional XPathTransformFilter: XPath expression
 XmlDSigXPathExpressionBase64.0   Optional XPathTransformFilter: Base 64 encoded XPath expression (Note: ALL expressions must be either base 64 encoded or not)
 XmlDSigNameSpace.0.Key.0         Optional XPathTransformFilter: namespace HashMap key
                                         The list can be continued, but there must be no gaps and no duplicates in the numbers.

                                         Parameters for XML DSig signatures of several documents:
 XmlDSigNodePath.n                node path for document n to be signed
 XmlDSigNodePathBase64.n          base64 encoded node path for document n to be signed (exclusive use with XmlDSigNodePath)
 XmlDSigTransformMethod.n         Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: transform method, can take values 0 (intersect), 1 (subtract), or 2 (union)
 XmlDSigXPathExpression.n         Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: XPath expression
 XmlDSigXPathExpressionBase64.n   Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: Base 64 encoded XPath expression (Note: ALL expressions must be either base 64 encoded or not)
 XmlDSigNameSpace.Key.n.0         Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: namespace HashMap key
 XmlDSigNameSpace.Value.n.0       Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: corresponding namespace HashMap value
 XmlDSigNameSpace.Key.n.1         Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: namespace HashMap key
 XmlDSigNameSpace.Value.n.1       Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: corresponding namespace HashMap value
                                         The list can be continued, but there must be no gaps and no duplicates in the numbers.
 XmlDSigTransformMethod.n.0       Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: transform method, can take values 0 (intersect), 1 (subtract), or 2 (union)
 XmlDSigXPathExpression.n.0       Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: XPath expression
 XmlDSigXPathExpressionBase64.n.0 Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: Base 64 encoded XPath expression (Note: ALL expressions must be either base 64 encoded or not)
 XmlDSigNameSpace.n.0.Key.0       Optional XPathTransformFilter for document n: namespace HashMap key

 PDFAnnotation.displayAnnotation  Optional PDF Annotation data item: "on" or "off"  to determine whether the item should be displayed
 PDFAnnotation.imageBase64        Optional PDF Annotation data item: signature image (Base 64 encoded)
 PDFAnnotation.imageURL           Optional PDF Annotation data item: signature image (URL)
 PDFAnnotation.displayImageText   Optional PDF Annotation data item: "on" or "off"  to determine whether a text should be added onto the signature image
 PDFAnnotation.location           Optional PDF Annotation data item: signature location
 PDFAnnotation.position           Optional PDF Annotation data item: signature position
 PDFAnnotation.reason             Optional PDF Annotation data item: signature reason
 PDFAnnotation.sigTextSizeAndPosition Optional PDF Annotation data item: annotation text size and position (6 digits: 1+2=size, 3+4=horizontal percentage, 5+6=vertical percentage)
 PDFAnnotation.showdate           Optional PDF Annotation data item: show signing date
 PDFAnnotation.width              Optional PDF Annotation data item: width of the signature annotation
 PDFAnnotation.height             Optional PDF Annotation data item: height of the signature annotation
